result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan D Robles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary amounts/sums at the rate of 25% of funds.  Balance during extended supervision, by the end of the sentence.  Failure to pay is civil judgment to be entered against defendant and subject to other collection.

superMiscConds.notes:
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with Pilar R. or AF dob 7/20/01 during the entire length of the sentence.
Cannot work or volunteer with children under the age of 16.

Comply with sex offender  reporting requirements.
Cannot work or volunteer with children under the age of 16.
Restitution set at zero.
*Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additioal charge of bail jumping.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge if not already done.
Court advised the defendant he cannot pssess firearms or body armor and cannot vote until his civil rigths are restored.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan D Robles

records.addlTxt: to and from Juan Robles, received and filed.

Per remittitur dated February 8, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001184 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on December 27, 2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jorge R. Fragoso is relieved from further representing Juan D. Robles.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order affirming

records.addlTxt: Per Order Dated December 27, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1184-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Jorge R. Fragoso is relieved from further representing Juan D. Robles. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

filed by defense, received and filed.

Defendant Juan D Robles in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Juan D Robles in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Dawn Maldonado.
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned to allow the state to comply with victim notification.  Court vacates 9-22-2014 jury trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 44.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-26-2014 at 09:00 am.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions and Instructions received and filed./ds

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, defendant Juan D Robles not in court, in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case set for a status.  State's Second Witness List received and filed.  State will be revoking its offer at the next court date.  Defense counsel discussed this matter with the defendant in the bullpen.  Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 8/29/2014 at 8:30 am and jury trial on 9/22/2014 at 9:00 a.m.   Case is adjourned to Br 44.

Case in court for bail review, defense no longer wishes to have a bail review and would like to schedule jury trial.    Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Pretrial scheduling order is signed and filed.  Further proceedings scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Juan D Robles in court with attorney Heather L Johnson.  Defendant Juan D Robles in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew.

Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case set for scheduling.  Br 12 is in trial and not able to hear this matter.  Defense request a bail hearing for the next court date. Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 06-06-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Heather L Johnson in court, defendant Juan D Robles not in court, in custody.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case set for scheduling.  Defense just received discovery.  State will provide defense counsel with an offer prior to the next court date.   Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Further proceedings scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-21-2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Juan D Robles in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Juan D Robles in custody.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:   City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Michael Kurowski.  Parties stipulate as to identification for purposes of today's hearing only.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 12.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.F. (DOB:  07/20/2001), Pilar R. and residence as well as no unsupervised contact with children under the age of 12 years.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
